text.tspan: Average shortfall from a poverty line of $30 a day (as a share of the
This is the average shortfall expressed as a share of the poverty line, sometimes called the income gap ratio . It captures
the depth of poverty of those living on less than $30 per day. Income here is measured after taxes and benefits. Income

has been
equivalized
â€“ adjusted to account for the fact that people in the same household can share costs like rent and

Note: This data is measured in
international-$
at 2021 prices to adjust for inflation and differences in living costs between countries.
